  • rqa.learn.data_handler

Source code for rqa.learn.data_handler


import logging
import os
from pathlib import Path
import pickle
import tempfile
from tqdm import tqdm

import requests

from nsml import IS_ON_NSML, DATASET_PATH

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)



[docs]class DataHandler:

    CACHE_ROOT = Path.home() / ".rqa_cache"

    def __init__(self):
        pass


[docs]    def read(self, file_path, encoding="utf-8"):
        path = Path(file_path)
        if path.exists():
            return path.read_bytes().decode(encoding)

        if IS_ON_NSML:
            path = DATASET_PATH / path
        if path.exists():
            return path.read_bytes().decode(encoding)

        if file_path.startswith("http"):
            return self._read_from_http(file_path, encoding=encoding)

        raise FileNotFoundError(f"{file_path} is not found.")


    def _read_from_http(self, url, encoding="utf-8"):
        temp_file = tempfile.TemporaryFile()
        req = requests.get(url, stream=True)
        for chunk in tqdm(req.iter_content(chunk_size=1024)):
            if chunk:  # filter out keep-alive new chunks
                temp_file.write(chunk)

        temp_file.seek(0)
        return temp_file.read().decode(encoding)


[docs]    def cache_token_counter(self, data_reader_config, tokenizer_name, obj=None):
        data_paths = os.path.basename(data_reader_config.train_file_path)
        if getattr(data_reader_config, "valid_file_path", None):
            data_paths += "#" + os.path.basename(data_reader_config.valid_file_path)
        if getattr(data_reader_config, "test_file_path", None):
            data_paths += "#" + os.path.basename(data_reader_config.test_file_path)

        path = self.CACHE_ROOT / data_reader_config.dataset / data_paths / tokenizer_name / "token_counter.pkl"
        return self.cache(path, obj=obj)



[docs]    def cache(self, path, obj=None):
        path = Path(path)
        if obj:
            self.write_pickle(path, obj)
        else:
            return self.read_pickle(path)



[docs]    def read_pickle(self, file_path):
        path = Path(file_path)
        if path.exist():
            with open(f"{path}.pickle", "rb") as in_file:
                logger.debug("read from cache data...")
                return pickle.load(in_file)
        else:
            return None



[docs]    def write_pickle(self, file_path, obj):
        os.makedirs(file_path, exist_ok=True)

        with open(f"{file_path}.pickle", "wb") as out_file:
            pickle.dump(obj, out_file)
